basics.name: Jakub Matraszek
basics.label: Software engineer
basics.summary: Backend developer with 7+ years of professional experience. Loves working on big, legacy systems with complicated business logic. Co-founder of one of the most efficient and fastest-growing animal advocacy group in Europe. Proficient with Ruby, but eager to learn something new. Currently investing his free time to master Rust.

work.summary: Upnext is a software agency specializing in financial technology and Internet of Things applications.
highlights: Developed and maintained two big applications: one being a loyalty system and second mobile terminal backend.

work.summary: Cubiware is a provider of software solutions for IPTV/DVB devices and systems.
highlights: Developed and maintained backend application for a digital television system deployed worldwide.

volunteer.summary: International animal advocacy group with particular focus on Central and Eastern Europe. From investigations to corporate outreach.

references.name: Tomasz Wałkuski
references.reference: Jakub, after joining Cubiware, quickly became one of the most valuable team members. Reliable, always eager to learn. It was a pleasure to work with him!

references.name: Dobrosława Gogłoza
references.reference: Jakub is one of the co-founders of Otwarte Klatki. He is in charge of IT and has always worked hard to allow Otwarte Klatki, currently an international organization, to grow. His knowledge and work allowed us to focus on what mattered most rather than worry about technical stuff. Jakub is a team player, but he is not afraid to go against the flow when he belives this will benefit the whole team.

projects.name: Microbrust
projects.description: A Linux interface to Arturia Microbrute
